verdict: Solid single campaign performance; $121 CPA is reasonable for roofing leads but limited growth structure

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 22 conversions tracked — conversion tracking is functional

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Conversion action types not fully verified — need to confirm calls + form fills are primary, not page views

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: No conversion value reported — roofing jobs vary significantly in value ($500 repair vs $15K replacement). Value tracking would enable smarter bidding

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Search campaign active — search term review cadence unknown

checks.name: Negative keyword lists exist
checks.finding: Negatives not verified — roofing searches often trigger DIY, insurance claim, and non-service queries

checks.name: Wasted spend assessment
checks.finding: 8.8% conversion rate (22 from 250 clicks) is solid. Suggests good keyword targeting and minimal waste

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: CTM prefix with service type — clear naming

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: Single campaign — limits granularity between new roofing vs repair vs emergency

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: No brand campaign. No LSA campaign. Limited structure for growth

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: No PMax — could help with Display/Maps visibility for local roofing

checks.name: Search CTR performance
checks.finding: 6.34% CTR is solid for roofing. 8.8% conversion rate is excellent

checks.name: Keyword coverage
checks.finding: Combined 'New & Repair' in single campaign — could benefit from separating service types

checks.name: Search volume
checks.finding: Only 3,944 impressions in 30 days — may be constrained by budget or narrow keyword targeting

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: 6.34% CTR vs ~5% roofing benchmark — above average

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: Ad creative testing not verified — recommend at least 2 RSAs per ad group

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Bidding strategy not verified — with 22 conv/month, Max Conversions would be appropriate

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: Service area targeting not verified — critical for roofing contractor

checks.name: Customer Match lists
checks.finding: No remarketing or Customer Match audiences visible

quickWins.action: Add conversion values — estimate average job values for new roofing vs repair to enable value-based bidding
Review search terms report — add negatives for DIY, insurance, free, cheap queries
Launch brand Search campaign for brand protection
Verify conversion tracking — confirm only calls + form fills are Primary (not page views)
Consider LSA campaign — roofing is a top LSA category with often lower CPAs

items: Verify conversion tracking — ensure only legitimate leads are counted
Add conversion values for different service types
Split campaign into New Roofing and Repair for better bid control
Launch LSA campaign — roofing is ideal for Local Services Ads
Test Max Conversions bidding if currently on Manual CPC
Expand keyword coverage for emergency roofing, specific service queries
If CPA stays under $150, increase budget to capture more of the market
Test PMax with before/after project photos for Display/YouTube visibility
Build remarketing audiences for return visitors
Seasonal adjustments for storm season when roofing demand spikes
